Sam Gregory - Web Developer & Digital Media Professional

Who I am

Hi There!

I am an experienced digital media and production professional currently working as a Front-End Developer for Digital Detox, a Web Development agency based in South London. Primarily using HTML CSS and JAVASCRIPT for key clients, such as Vodafone and Cancer Research UK. In my spare time i also create websites freelance as well as using After Effects to apply post-production VFX. This can be seen in 2 Rathergood productions Uncle Wormsley's Christmas and Ship of Eagles as well as HARK's music promo for Scarlett Extremeties

Before my work at Digital Detox, for three years I leveraged and honed my technical expertise using Adobe CS and Developer skills (HTML, CSS, Javascript, PHP, MySQL, Actionscript) on key projects at Framestore in their Design and Digital portfolio. A rewarding experience spanning interactive, VFX, motion graphics, titles and credits, and motion capture. Highlights include building British Airways’ “Take a Plane Down Your Street” web/Facebook app, which has been said to be The most successful social media app ever (Mail On Sunday, 23 June 2012), titles and end rollers for the film “Tyrannosaur”, and working on visual graphics for Secret Cinema’s “Prometheus” show.

In addition, my interest in live performance led me to co-create Velvet Trumpet, a theatre company in which I am Production Manager. I was thrilled to be at the helm of their first production “A Model Life”, which ran at The Network Theatre to rave reviews. Velvet Trumpet's latest production 'Don't Disturb the Driver' was featured at the 2013 Edinburgh Fringe, and we now hope to hold regular nights at the Hen & Chickens Theatre Pub with our first show being "Toast".

Specialties: Front end web Development (HTML/CSS/Javascript), VFX (AFTER Effects), Project Management/Production.

Solutions

Websites

Development - With countless years developing front-end websites and over 4 years professional experience I can provide solutions in front-end and back-end using Wordpress CMS. Specialising in HMTL5, CSS3 and Javascript with considerations towards SEO and accessibility I can produce clean, accessible code with you or your customers in mind

Design - I am able to provide workable designs if required and then move forward into development for a seamless transition with ideas generated for a consistent product.

Compositor

Having worked in Television, and film both professionally and as a freelancer, I am capable of adding VFX and SFX to a production.

Digital Detox 2012 - Present

Front-End Developer

My work at Digital Detox involves high end bespoke UX and UI web development using primarily HTML, CSS, and Javascript and on occasions PHP. Digital Detox look to create high quality web products including websites and web applications for clients such as Vodafone, Bupa, Cancer Research. Digital Detox look to adopt the newest technologies from as they come available to help make the workflow as quick and cleanly as possible. 'DD's small team specialise in an Agile workflow where the team remain a tight unit to help one another achieve their goals and deliver great products.

Velvet Trumpet March 2012 - Present

Media/Marketing Manager

Founded in 2012, Velvet Trumpet is an “extracurricular” project. Run an oranised by myself and three others, Velvet Trumpet are a South London-based theatre company with a passion for intimate new comedies which delve into the humour and pathos of unexplored occupations and unexamined lives. I am responsible for organising media and marketing along with managing company. I also created and run the website.

  • Money Womb (2015)
  • The Choirmaster (2014)
  • Soggy Brass: A night of new-comedy writing

Framestore 2009 - 2012

Digital Developer

Initially employed as a Flash Designer, My role quickly diversified to a diverse portfolio including web development, graphic work and high-end animation. Over the course of 3 years I touched on a huge variety of cutting-edge mediums ranging from sports stadium 'Jumbo-Trons', to film VFX and titles, TV, music videos, web, smartphones, online apps and graphic work.

Highlights include building British Airways’ “Take a Plane Down Your Street” web / Facebook app, which has been said to be “the most successful social media app ever” (Mail On Sunday, 23 June 2012), titles and end rollers for “Tyrannosaur”, and working on visual graphics for Secret Cinema’s “Prometheus” show.

  • BA ‘Take a Taxi Down Your Street’ - Developer
  • Secret Cinema’s Promethius - Titles and VFX
  • LG 'Rare Butterflies' Web app - Developer
  • Tyrannosaur - Front/End Titles

Freelancer 2009 - Present Digital Developer

I reflect my role in Framestore as a generalist. Primarily I focus on web development. This role is self managed and In some cases I have employed team members to help on larger projects and managed them. Through Framestore i was able to apply for a vacancy Rathergood where hiring for. The budget was low and expectations were high as the Rathergood’s first feature length film starred the voice talents of Steve Coogan as narrator, plus Julian Barratt and Julia Davis. It was an exciting project and I approached each day with a smile, even around my day job. I recruited an After Effects freelancer to help out in which I personally managed. We achieved everything beyond expectation and the client was very happy.

  • 3DUX - Web Developer (HTML/Javascript/CSS/Wordpress)
  • Uncle Wormsley’s Christmas - Compositor (After Effects)
  • Velvet Trumpet Site - Web Development (HTML/Javascript/CSS/Wordpress) - View on Github
  • ID Creative Media - Web Development (HTML/Javascript/CSS/Wordpress)
